bill_title: require quarterly reporting of alleged crimes and civil proceedings involving grain transactions and to provide a penalty therefor.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to require quarterly reporting of alleged crimes and civil proceedings involving grain transactions and to provide a penalty therefor. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That chapter 49-26 be amended with a NEW SECTION: A grain buyer holding a Class A license shall provide written notification to the commission, at the time of submitting the quarterly balance sheet pursuant to § 49-45-22, if the grain buyer: (1) Becomes aware of: (a) Embezzlement in excess of fifty thousand dollars; (b) Theft in excess of fifty thousand dollars; or (c) Fraud in excess of fifty thousand dollars, allegedly perpetrated upon the grain buyer; (2) Becomes a creditor in a bankruptcy proceeding and has a claim in excess of fifty thousand dollars; or (3) Becomes a party to a civil proceeding, in which there is a claim in excess of fifty thousand dollars. If a willful violation of this section results in a financial loss to a grain supplier, the violation is punishable as theft under chapter 22-30A.
